full_summary:
=====================================

**Government Tender Announcement**

### Title
Design and Development of Panoramic Imaging Components and Systems

### Solicitation Number
WS3402508369

### Publication Date
October 21, 2022

### Tender Closing Date
December 1, 2022, 2:00 PM EST

### Expiration Date
December 1, 2022 (Tender is expired)

### Notice Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

### Procurement Method
Competitive - Open Bidding

### Location
Québec, Canada

### Selection Criteria
Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

### Trade Agreements
Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contracting Entity
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5

### End User
Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC)
400 Cumberland St, Ottawa, Ontario K1N 1J8

### Contact Information
Alexandra Parent
alexandra.parent@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Notice Link
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/13517154?extsite=MTM1MTcxNTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the design, analysis, characterization, and development of panoramic imaging components and systems located in Valcartier, Québec, Canada.Interested vendors must submit their bid with all required supporting documentation by December 1, 2022, at the latest. All bids submitted after this date will be considered non-responsive. The bid will be evaluated based on technical merit and price, and the company with the highest combined rating will be selected.The Notice can be downloaded from the discovery.ariba.com website, and interested vendors should refer to Annex A for detailed information. 

I followed your guidelines in rewriting the entry: reformatted to Markdown format, removing irrelevant information, and condensing the text to 400 words. If you need further clarification or require any additional details, please let me know.  I've created this rewritten document "Government Tender Announcement" with a redone structure to present relevant and concise information when potential contractors are searching for it.
